H0.text: Neurons are the four basic types: unipolar, bipolar, multipolar, and pseudounipolar.

H1.text: Ions are the four basic types of unipolar, bipolar, multipolar, and pseudounipolar.

H2.text: Protons are the four basic types: unipolar, bipolar, multipolar, and pseudounipolar.

H3.text: Electrons are the four basic types of unipolar, bipolar, multipolar, and pseudounipolar.

A4.text: Most neurons can be anatomically characterized as: Unipolar, Bipolar, Multipolar, and Pseudounipolar

A5.text: Anaxonic: where the axon cannot be distinguished from the dendrite(s)
